column5: I was trying to post pics through my iPhone but can't seem to figure out how. Any suggestions?
A top water popper when bass are out of season is not a good lure choice. Good luck on posting the pic of the perch.
It wouldn't be a good choice if you caught a bass with it and kept fishing that lure, next weekend lots of people will be throwing them for walleye and pike.

Ya i guess your right RHF, I wasn't trying for it at all though, I went looking for Pike because I heard it was open as of May 1st. Tried various spinnerbaits with no luck whatsoever. Any suggestions ? Hoping to go out again today. Email me if you prefer that instead. [emailÂ protected]
Anyone know how to upload pics from iPhone to mobile OFC site? Please help.
Pretty sure the pike are OOS too. Stick with the panfish population for now. Number 4 and 5 Mepps spinners work good once pike season opens.
Pike are closed on Niapenco until May 12.....
Already sent him a PM about it..
I'm telling you guys, I was told they allowed pile fishing as of May 1st. Catch and release only of course.
Nope, regs say 2nd sat in May which is May 12 as pics posted above. Couldn't find any exceptions in the guide. Believe the regs, not someone's word.
I really wonder who is spreading this rumour, there have been a few instances where people have heard of this made up exception.
Maybe you should call them and find out for sure. 905-692-3228
The confusion is that it is a designated fish sanctuary, C and R for bass , pike and walleye, BUT !!!! the open seasons still apply for targeting those species.
that makes more sense, not like any sane person would eat out of there anyways!
For sure. I know that next Sat is the opener for Pike and Walleye . Can't wait.
Crappie derby there this sat. Tons of Crappies to be caught.
Hope to be there with my 4 yr old Boy. S/B fun stuff
